markdownRemark.html:
What does this snippet of code returns?

  function Greetings(name) {
    return 
      "Good morning, " + name
  }

Greetings("Giovanni")

When inserting a new line, javascript implicitly add a semicolon at the end of it. This means that the return statement would look like return; that evaluate to undefined.

frontmatter.title: Implicit semicolon insertion
frontmatter.date: Thu Oct 24 2019 16:09:25 GMT+0200 (Central European Summer Time)

frontmatter.title: Identity Crisis
